title: Naming Convention Refinement Initiative
description: Standardize and clarify naming conventions across the entire AI Lab Framework for features, names, variables, and all other important elements. The goal is to improve readability, maintainability, and consistency, reducing cognitive load for both human developers and AI agents.
acceptance_criteria: A comprehensive naming convention guidelines document is created and approved.
Existing codebase elements are reviewed and refactored to adhere to the new conventions.
Automated checks (e.g., linting rules) are implemented to enforce naming convention compliance.
Readability and consistency of the codebase are measurably improved.

steps: Analyze the existing codebase in `core/`, `projects/`, and `tools/` to identify current naming patterns and inconsistencies.
Review best practices for Python, TypeScript/JavaScript, and shell scripting naming conventions.
Draft a `NAMING_CONVENTIONS.md` document defining clear rules for all elements (directories, files, variables, classes, etc.).
Store the new guideline document in `core/guidelines/`.
Research and configure linting tools (e.g., Ruff for Python, ESLint for JS/TS) to automatically enforce the new naming conventions.
Integrate these new linting rules into the existing pre-commit hooks (`.pre-commit-config.yaml`).
Systematically refactor the existing codebase, starting with the `core/` directory, to align with the new `NAMING_CONVENTIONS.md`.
Apply the refactoring to the `tools/` and `projects/` directories.
Ensure all tests pass after refactoring.
Update the main `GEMINI.md` and `DEVELOPER_GUIDE.md` to reference the new `NAMING_CONVENTIONS.md`.
Perform a final review of the changes and the new guideline document.

notes: This initiative will contribute significantly to the long-term maintainability and understandability of the framework, especially as AI agents become more involved in development.
